alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 6:02PM MST until March 24 at 1:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Havasu Creek basin in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 100 AM MST Friday. * At 557 PM MST, stream gauge reports indicated high flows continue along Havasu Creek from Heather Wash through Supai to the Colorado River. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Previous heavy rain and snow melt producing flash flooding in and around the Havasu Creek basin. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek, Coconino Wash, Little Coyote Canyon, Pasture Wash, Heather Wash, Black Tank Wash and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Residents, campers, and hikers should hustle to higher ground immediately! Stay away Havasu Creek and tributary creeks and washes! Travel throughout Supai Village will be limited. Homes...property... and roadways near Havasu Creek in Supai Village will be flooded. Much of Supai Campground will likely be inundated.
